logic

Class Hero

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Character
      • logic.Hero
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Hero
extends Character
    This class represents a specific type of Character. This specific type is the game's hero (good guy), its main purpose is to end the game without being fatally injured or captured by the different levels enemies.
    Author:
    Jo√£o Vieira, Susana Lima
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Hero(int valX, int valY, boolean hasClub)
      Creates a new Hero in preferred x and y values with or without a weapon accordingly to the hasClub value.

      • Hero

        public Hero(int valX,

        Creates a new Hero in preferred x and y values.
        Parameters:
        valX - the new value of x
        valY - the new value of y

      • Hero

        public Hero(int valX,
            int valY,
            boolean hasClub)
        Creates a new Hero in preferred x and y values with or without a weapon accordingly to the hasClub value. All this Hero flags are set to false
        Parameters:
        valX - the new value of x
        valY - the new value of y
        hasClub - true if the Hero to be created is an ArmedHero (has a weapon), false otherwise

      • updatePosition

        public void updatePosition(char command)
        Updates this Hero current position accordingly to the given command. If this Hero has a weapon also updates its position accordingly.
        Overrides:
        updatePosition in class Character
        Parameters:
        command - the char used to update this Character position

      • addWeapon

        public void addWeapon()
        Creates and adds to this Hero a new Club, if this Hero does not already have one. The new weapon is positioned on heros' position.
